net.sf.appia.protocols.group.events
Class GroupSendableEvent

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.appia.core.Event
      net.sf.appia.core.events.SendableEvent
          net.sf.appia.protocols.group.events.GroupSendableEvent
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AckViewEvent, Alive, ApplCastEvent, ApplSendEvent, Block, ClearWhiteBoardEvent, ConcurrentViewEvent, DeliverViewEvent, DrawEvent, GossipGroupEvent, ImageEvent, InstallView, JGCSGroupEvent, JGCSSendEvent, KickEvent, LeaveEvent, MouseButtonEvent, NullEvent, PerfCastEvent, PerfSendEvent, ProbeEvent, Retransmission, Retransmit, SeqOrderEvent, StableGossip, Suspect, SwitchEvent, SymmetricAlive, Sync, TextEvent, TokenEvent, TotalOrderEvent, UniformInfoEvent, UniformInfoEvent, UniformInfoEvent
public class GroupSendableEvent
extends SendableEvent

Superclass of all Events generated by the Group Communication protocols that will be sent through the underlying network.
The meaning of the source and dest attributes is a little different.

  • dest is meaningfull only if the Event implements Send and is descending (direction==Direction.DOWN). In that case it contains an array with the ranks of the destinataries.
  • source is meaningfull only if the Event is ascending (direction==Direction.UP). In that case it contains the Endpt of the sender.
It extends the regular SendableEvent by adding the group id and the view id. These attributes are mandatory.
It also adds an origin attribute only meaningfull in ascending Events, that contains the rank of the sender. The attribute is mandatory

NOTICE: if you invert a descending GroupSendableEvent, ie it becomes ascending, you must set the source and orig attributes.

Version:
0.1
Author:
Alexandre Pinto
See Also:
Send, GroupEvent, SendableEvent
